summary: An FBI Electronic Communication from the San Juan/St. Thomas Resident Agency detailing a report of public corruption and money laundering in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. The report alleges that Jeffrey Epstein paid off a Port Authority Director to facilitate the construction of a private hangar for his jet.

persons.name: Reynaldo Clark
persons.context: Came to the FBI St. Thomas Resident Agency to report allegations of public corruption involving multiple Virgin Islands officials and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Albert Bryan
persons.context: Named by the source as being involved in alleged public corruption in St. Thomas.

persons.name: Carlton Dowe
persons.context: Allegedly paid off by Jeffrey Epstein to push through construction of a private aviation hangar for Epstein's jet.

persons.name: Arturo Watlington
persons.context: Named by the source as being involved in alleged public corruption in St. Thomas.

persons.name: John DeJongh
persons.role: Former Governor of the Virgin Islands

connections.description: Epstein allegedly paid off Dowe, the Port Authority Director, to facilitate construction of a private hangar.
Clark reported to the FBI about Epstein's alleged corrupt payment to Carlton Dowe.

events.title: FBI Report Filed on Corruption
events.description: Reynaldo Clark reports to the FBI St. Thomas Resident Agency alleging public corruption and money laundering involving Virgin Islands officials and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Bribery for Hangar Construction
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein allegedly paid off Port Authority Director Carlton Dowe to push through construction of a new Standard Aviation hangar on St. Thomas for his private jet.

keyFacts: A source, Reynaldo Clark, reported allegations of public corruption and money laundering in St. Thomas to the FBI.
The allegations specifically involve Jeffrey Epstein paying off Port Authority Director Carlton Dowe to secure approval for a private hangar for his jet.
Other named individuals implicated in the broader corruption report include Governor Albert Bryan, Attorney Arturo Watlington, and former Governor John DeJongh.
The document is an FBI Electronic Communication (FD-1057) classified as a Sensitive Investigative Matter.
The alleged corruption facilitated Epstein's desire to park his private jet inside a hangar when traveling to/from St. Thomas with guests.
